everyoneShouldKnow: Great Customer Service!
title: Customer Service
comment: I have stayed in very nice hotels and some not so nice. This hotel was nice and clean. I was quite impressed after staying there for a day the next afternoon the clerk welcomed me by name! she smiled and was professional and friendly. The 1900 Bar restaurant downstairs had good food. I was beyond impressed with our server Sally. She was gracious and kind and went beyond her job. (Give that lady a raise!). This type of customer service is a breath of fresh air and not seen very often these days. Thank you for a great stay!

everyoneShouldKnow: Very clean and convenient for cruise departures.
title: Some staff outstanding, some not
comment: We stayed here before going on a cruise, and the room was comfortable and spotless. The housekeeper, Ruth, was friendly and went out of her way to make sure we were happy. The shuttle staff and front desk staff were also very professional and gave good service. The wait staff in the restaurant, however, was abysmal. We waited over 15 minutes to get water when we were the only diners present, then another 15 to order, and another 35 minutes to get our food, during which time we had no staff attention of any sort. Put Ruth in the dining room, is what I say! But otherwise a very nice stay - I would recommend everything but the restaurant.

everyoneShouldKnow: Do Not Stay At The Belvoir!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
title: Dirty, Moldy and Overpriced!!!!!!!!!!!!!
comment: The cleaning staff didn't clean the room and we had to call the front desk for clean towels annd toilet paper. The bedroom's partition wall was rotted and molding. TV remote control didn't work.

title: Hotel is ok, but the staff is GREAT
comment: From the doorman to the front desk, to the house keeping staff - every one made you feel welcomed. As a Platinum member for a number of years, I was quite impress by the level of service and attention to detail. The hotel rooms are typical Belvoir style/standard. However, what makes this hotel great is the staff.

everyoneShouldKnow: Would be very nice for the price if they paid attention to the little things.
title: Dropped the Ball a Few Times
comment: I am a Gold Preferred BPG member and check in on 2/1/12. I stay here six or so times a year. I am fully able bodied.

everyoneShouldKnow: I would recommend this hotel for the budget-conscious traveler that's traveling with children. It's fun that the Belvoir resembles a castle, but the rooms are too outdated to be whimsical.
title: Great for Disney
comment: We stayed at the Belvoir in Anaheim when we were in California for a business trip and decided to drive down to trek around Disneyland Resort. I hopped online and booked the reservation through the iPhone app, satisfied that the price was nice and the photos looked like the hotel was nicely renovated.

everyoneShouldKnow: Staff is amazing. Covered parking in winter. They will do whatever it takes for your stay to be awesome.
title: University Lounge
comment: I have to say that Tina, the bartender in the lounge, is such an asset, she is always smiling, has a great attitude, it is really what guests want when they are traveling. Such a breath of fresh air in this day of diminished customer service. Can't wait to return!!

title: Other reviews
comment: I just read some of the reviews on this site. Being in the service business, I found this hotel to go far above and beyond to satisfy and take care of guests.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great Location
title: Clean and Friendly
comment: This hotel has a fantastic staff and location. They provide the basiscs everyone wants CLEAN and FRIENDLY. I would reccomend this property to any guest wanting a great stay in the Austin Area.

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff were unfriendly! My stay was unsatisfactory.
title: This hotel is unsatisfactory!
comment: The front desk staff was very unfriendly when I arrived. My room was unacceptable. The bathroom was visibly dirty,the shower head was broken and the room was hot because the air conditioning did not work. I was very disappointed with my stay at this hotel.

everyoneShouldKnow: great place to use as a base for a weekend trip to DC.
title: Great staff!
comment: The staff here is beyond helpful. They went out of their way in every way. Clean, well kept rooms and common areas.

everyoneShouldKnow: Large hotel and good location
title: Nice Wharf Escape
comment: Thomas, the Concierge, was grand! Helped with full day - from breakfast to dinner and spots in between. Even though quite busy (weekend & football game), they were very helpful & friendly.

everyoneShouldKnow: Close to airport, easy access to highway
title: Needs updating
comment: Stayed 3 nights. Room decor was okay, but was next to noisy road. If I go back will ask for room facing courtyard. Gym is too small, line-ups for equipment and one eliptical in need of repair. Staff in Club Lounge very nice, but did not know where Toronto is!

everyoneShouldKnow: No late night menu. Late night staff rude.
title: Customer Service
comment: I am a frequent traveler and have stayed at many hotels in the states. One of terrible things about this hotel is customer service. I ordered food from an outside restaurant and gave permission for the pizza guy to come straight to my room. The front desk person was rude and simply said it was the hotel's policy that the pizza guy can't come straight to my room and deliver the pizza. No further explanation from the front desk. Please explain your policy and don't be rude.

everyoneShouldKnow: Good location right off of I-89 and close to airport
title: Great staff
comment: I stay at this property several times per year. The staff here is always professional and friendly. Always get recognition as a platinum member and I am always upgraded to the club floor. It's a shame that a property of this size has only one suite. The club lounge is nice, but is very small and the evening food options are lacking.

everyoneShouldKnow: Very clean and a good location
title: Tina
comment: I always enjoy visiting the bar when I stay at this hotel. Tina always has a friendly smile and is very welcoming.

everyoneShouldKnow: Don't ever stay there!
title: Stay at the Belvoir O'hara
comment: Terrible, terrible, terrible. Very unpleasant experience and the worst hotel we have ever stayed at. And, it happend twice; New year's eve 2011 and 2009. Need a lot of improvement for hotel, management and staff. I have stayed at motels that were better and the staff more experienced! Don't stay there under any circumstances.The food is horrible, especially the buffet breakfast they wanted you to pay $20 which was not worth the soupy, powered eggs, stale bakery, hashbrowns were cold in the middle, bacon too well done, the juices and the fruit was rancid! Horrible experience the entire 3-day stay. Will never stay at this Belvoir again!

everyoneShouldKnow: Best Hotel so far in La Guardia/ JFK area but needs better link to JFK to get Biz
title: Very good could be great
comment: Excellent direct metro link to manhattan,times sq. Standards at hotel generally very good but needs extra attention to detail. Main disappointment was lack of wine/ beer in club lounge should be included at least for 2 hours, like many other airport locations. Better than JFK Hotel options but needs better transportation links.

everyoneShouldKnow: convenient location
title: convenience of Location
comment: For those who are taking a cruise out of Fort Lauderdale, this is an ideal location. It is about halfway between the FLL airport and the cruise ship port. It is right on the beach, and the beach is beautiful. The hotel can be busy at checkin and checkout time, but the staff was ever courteous and helpful. The rooms are nice and well appointed.

title: Comfortable, Clean and Courteous!
comment: Wonderful hotel. Clean rooms, trendy but not in an overwhelming/offputting way, friendly/well-trained staff, good airport location with cool views if you like that (yet very quiet in the halls and outside the windows), free airport transportation, good food. I like this place and would stay again.

title: Very nice staff
comment: From Natalia in housekeeping to Akmet, Mariluci, Erica and others in the lounge and at the front desk everyone was very pleasant and responsive.

everyoneShouldKnow: Above average property.
title: A solid Grandbourne property
comment: Always happy when I stay here. The hotel is very well maintained and the staff is always friendly and helpful. The restaurant is above your standard Sherraton fair, which is always a big plus for a buisness traveller.

title: Convience location
comment: Hotel room is nice and clean. Staff always forgot to give me $5 voucher or 500 Grandbourne points when I hang out "no need to clean up my room" tag.

everyoneShouldKnow: Friendly staff, great plat treatment
title: Great platinum treatment!
comment: Just got back from 5 night stay. Upgraded to a suite at checkin with out asking. Lots of suites in inventory, so high probability of upgrade.

everyoneShouldKnow: Under Construction
title: ** Under Construction **
comment: Construction is underway on floors 20 and lower. Banging begins around 7 am and can continue until after 10 pm. This may not effect some travelers but I found it aweful. The hotel did offer me a new room which I appreciated but it was like being offered a wine cooler on the Titanic.

everyoneShouldKnow: $23 PARKING
title: Average service, Uncomfortable beds
comment: I just completed a 1-night stay at this hotel. It was a very UN-impressive experience to say the least. I had a room that was supposedly just remodeled, but the carpet was peeling from the floor and the towel holder in the bathroom was pulling out of the wall. Worst of all, the supposedly "new" beds were EXTREMELY uncomfortable! They were high on 1 side and low on the other. They felt like they were several years old! I wouldn't stay at this property again.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great staff :)
title: Great staff
comment: I stayed her every week for 3 months and the staffs really made me feel welcomed here. Special shout out to Trevor, the room service expert and Stephanie, the welcoming front desk receptionist.

everyoneShouldKnow: Don't go here.
title: San Diego Boat Show
comment: The overall visit was a disappointment. The waiter at the resturant was more suitable to a diner than a nice resturant. the razor I requested from housekeeping never arrived. And because I chose not to replace the towels and linens to help the environment, the room was untouched by the maids. The beds weren't made and coffee and coffee cups not replenished. And for a hotel that was associated with the San Diego boat show not to have a shuttle to the show is rediculous. The shuttle between building could have easily accomodated the guest.

everyoneShouldKnow: It's probably a bit overpriced for the overall experience.
title: Mixed experience
comment: I stayed at this hotel for four nights, three of them because I was attending a conference in the hotel. My organization made the reservations and sent me the confirmation information. I called the hotel, gave them the reservation number and asked to have a fourth night added at my own expense. I was told that I would need to speak to someone in accounting to make arrangements to have the last night paid for on a different credit card. I was routed to accounting, explained my situation, gave them my credit card information and was faxed a paper that showed that I was paying for the fourth night on a personal credit card.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location, great staff and beautiful hotel.
title: The Best Hotel I've Ever Stayed In!
comment: I stayed at the Belvoir New Orleans during an AEA Meeting. Upon arrival, I basically got to pick my room. All of the little things (decor, cleanliness, the awesome view, down to the toiletries, towels and bathrobe) really made the long meetings worth the trip. I was very impressed with the staff and the facilities. The hotel is beautiful, and with the coming renovations I'm sure it will be even more grand and inviting. This was my first time visiting New Orleans - I'm definitely coming back and staying at the Belvoir!

everyoneShouldKnow: Great Location
title: Stayed for Business
comment: Had a great time! Rooms were comfortable and clean

everyoneShouldKnow: Do not plan on parking a car onsite.
title: Seems more like a motel
comment: Subpar even for Belvoir. I am a frequent traveler and perhaps a tough critic. Still, the level of service here was no better than average. The condition of the room was well below par.

title: Lousy Housekeeping
comment: I have the memberships with the other hotel chains, so most of the time I stayed with other hotels other than Belvoir. For my last vacation in early January 2012, I decided to try Belvoir Garden Grove - Anaheim South Hotel since I was looking for a nice hotel near Disneyland Resort and with the better rate, and I expected to be good because it is Belvoir. However, my three days stays were very

everyoneShouldKnow: Accommodating and lovely!
title: Accommodating
comment: I always enjoy your accommodations. And I found the hospitality of the sales team, the chefs, and the guest services to be outstanding at my most recent visit. Thank you!

guestFrom: San Miguel de Tucumᮬ Tucumᮬ Argentina
everyoneShouldKnow: Near everything
title: Great location and amenities
comment: Its perfect to stay in Manhattan, from here you're able to go anywhere in a while by any tranportation. Great Lounge Club.

everyoneShouldKnow: Because the Big Island is well.....so big....this hotel is centrally located on the island and makes day trips easier. The rooms look a little dated but comfortable and you really can't beat the ocean view.
title: This hotel has a beautiful view
comment: We thought the view from our room was beautiful but because our room was right above the pool, it was very noisy at night.

everyoneShouldKnow: Excellent location
title: Excellent BPG Recognition
comment: This hotel is convenient (attached to the mall and Prudential Center). Excellent lounge, upgrade, and Platinum recognition. Nice staff and hotel overall. What all Belvoirs should aspire to be like.

everyoneShouldKnow: Have a starbucks in the lobby (with terrible service but the coffee is good)
title: I keep trying...
comment: This hotel looks good....but upon closer inspection...is dirty. The bedding duvets don't appear to be washed between stays. The carpet not vacuumed...hair everywhere. Beause I travel so much I've learn to always reserve a room with 2 beds...in case one is dirty I can sleep in the other on. Belvoir needs to improve.

everyoneShouldKnow: I didn't drive, but valet parking was around $50 a night ... BEWARE
title: Great Stay and Excellent Location
comment: I just stayed at this property last weekend. I am just a gold with BPG but was upgraded to Club Level and was highly impressed with the level of service. The view of the Navy Pier was wonderful.

everyoneShouldKnow: Book a rate that includes breakfast
title: New Years Eve!
comment: Great Suite upgrade. Room 1402 had the perfect view for new years eve. We had a blast, thanks to the Front Desk for taking great care of us.

everyoneShouldKnow: Very friendly staff
title: Great staff
comment: amazing staff! we got a room upgrade with a beautiful view! I had a great time at the Brazilain Carnival recommended by Vany at the desk who is also from Brazil!

title: great location/view but facilities could be better
comment: Unlike other reviewers, I thought the staff did a great job--they were very gracious and accommodating and everyone was very professional and friendly. This is the 2nd time I have stayed at the Belvoir New Orleans and room itself was just okay--the bed was comfy but bathroom was small and the shower severely lacked water pressure. I'm glad to see that there are renovation plans.

everyoneShouldKnow: The Belvoir Portsmouth will meet your every need with a big smile, class and gratitude!
title: Best Place to hold your next Meeting!
comment: My company held our annual 2-day Sales kick off meeting in January 2012 at the Belvoir Portsmouth Harbor Hotel in Portsmouth, NH which included 120 + attendees. We have used other Hotels in the area for this annual meeting, but I must tell you that the Belvoir Portsmouth was by far, The Best meeting experience and hotel I have ever had the pleasure of dealing with. Every detail was the way I asked for it if not better, the entire staff was the best; very pleasant and professional, and the food was superior! And to top it off, the hotel was classy, beautiful and their location is perfectly located in historical NH Seacoast. They made me look great and my meeting was a great success! Thank you Belvoir for a Superb Job! We will be back! Peggy

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff makes this place!
title: Music Night!
comment: Came to Austin to catch some music down on south congress and found this hotel to be a great place to stay!

everyoneShouldKnow: Impeccable Service, Superb Location, Large Indoor Pool & Fitness Center, Incredible Views of the City. Easy Walking distance to the Loop, Magnificent Mile, & Navy Pier!
title: Beyond AWESOME Service!
comment: We checked in with 2 rooms ... told the front desk we were there celebrating our daughter's "Sweet 16" birthday. Returning to the hotel after dinner out, there was a knock at her door with the kindest gentleman delivering decadent chocolate cupcakes for her and her girlfriends :) Many thanks to Rachel for her thoughtfulness and generosity. Will definitely be "Our Place to Stay" for all of our Chicago visits.

everyoneShouldKnow: If you self park, keep your key!
title: I love this hotel but....
comment: I stayed here maybe 2 years ago and I LOVE the view and actually had a really good experience. This time, not so much. Check in time was at 3. I got to the hotel at 3:45 only to be told that my room wasn't ready. No big deal. I asked how long it would take until my room was ready and was told no more than 30 minutes. The girl working at the front desk took my phone number and said they would call when my room was ready. I decided to go for a walk to waste time. I walked a ways and no phone call. After a little while longer, there was still no phone call, so I decided to walk back to the hotel to check and see if my room was ready. It was 4:45 at that time. I had to wait in line to see if my room was ready. It was finally ready but they had never called to let me know. I was sure they were going to at least comp my parking or something but they did not. I didn't want to make a big deal and let it ruin my weekend so I just went up to my room. Everything looked ok except for the greasy hand prints on the sliding glass window. I made the best of my situation because it could have been worse. Fast forward to the next day when I am checking out. I was not told that if you self park, you need your key to get out of the parking lot (so don't use express check out). I used express check out and went to my truck and couldn't get out of the parking lot as there is no attendant in the little booth. So I had to park again and go get another key so I could leave. It took another 20 minutes until I was finally able to leave. When I checked my bank account to see what they charged me for the room, it was almost $100 more than it was before I left and I didn't use any internet or the minibar or anything. I didn't get a receipt emailed to me to let me know what the extra charges were for either. Like I said, I love this hotel but I don't think I will be staying here for a while.

everyoneShouldKnow: Very friendly staff
title: Nice Place For The Price
comment: One of the most friendly staff I have ever met.

everyoneShouldKnow: Banquet food and wait staff OUTSTANDING!
title: Banquet
comment: The room was great, just a bit warm and I was unable to get the temp down below 70. The banquet food was outstanding as was the wait staff. The only issue I and several others had was waiting for the elevators. They seemed to take forever to respond to your call. Also, our parking was supposed to be covered under our room reservation and I was surprised to find that I still owed $5 when I attempted to leave the garage.

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff is fantastic
title: Clean rooms, friendly staff
comment: Everyone I encountered on the staff was incredibly helpful and friendly. My room was very clean and quiet. This was my first time at this hotel, but I will definately stay here again the next time I am in Austin.

everyoneShouldKnow: Excellent experience, good value!
title: Excellent experience
comment: Prior to arrival, I received a welcome email from the property manager which I thought was a wonderful touch! We were greeted promptly and assisted with our luggage. The check-in experience was smooth. Our room was comfortable. I chose this property specifically for its proximity to Universal and the Queen sized beds. It did not disappoint. We were especially pleased to have access to the parking garage until midnight the day we checked out. This allowed us to meet family for breakfast in the morning and come back and park the car without paying extra for parking on our last day at the park. I would highly recommend this hotel!

everyoneShouldKnow: The location is perfect
title: Fabulous stay
comment: My husband and I had a short stay at this property and cannot say enough about the location and the wonderful staff. The hotel is under renovation so we were very thankful to be upgraded to an already renovated ocean front suite, a recognition of my ongoing platinum status. The room was wonderful and the views right over the ocean. We love the Manta Bar, a great place to relax, eat, drink and enjoy the ocean views. The employees of the hotel went above and beyond to be helpful, everyone we met had a smile on their face.

everyoneShouldKnow: how fantastic both the resort and the staff are
title: Fantastic Experience
comment: I just returned from hosting a group of 25 people at the Belvoir Sand Key Resort. I am confident that I can speak for everyone in the group when I say just how fantastic our stay was. From the moment that each of us checked in, every member of the hotel staff went out of their way to welcome us, inquire as to how they could make our stay any better, and assist with our every need. The recently remodeled weight room and lounge were clean, bright and featured state of the art equipment. The pool and beach were cleaned each day. We went as a group to Rustys for dinner. It was by far the best dining experience which we had during our entire stay in Clearwater Beach. We recommend the Belvoir Sand Key for anyone looking to hold a meeting or a family reunion.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location and very friendly staff
title: Great Weekend in Iowa City
comment: My husband and I were visiting our daughter at the University of Iowa and stayed for the weekend at this hotel. From the minute we checked in to when we left the service was perfect. It was a busy weekend due to several events but the staff never missed a beat.

everyoneShouldKnow: There are other hotels just next door for less money that offer better room services.
title: Don't stay here!!
comment: There are plenty of hotels right next door that will offer FREE refrigerators and microwaves. I was denied even being able to pay for a fridge due to lack of inventory. Paid $120 night where my smart friends enjoyed a fridge, and microwave for half the price. Should you visit the restaurant, I hope you will not have the terrible service we had. If you see a crowd, don't even bother. They only have so many plates... I'll leave it at that...

everyoneShouldKnow: it very nice although they tell you there is no fee for dogs under 20 lbs it is not true.
title: pet policy
comment: I recently booked a night here only because of their pet policy. I have a dog less than 2 llbs and when I went out to eat with family I got a message that I would be charged a fee because I did not inform the front desk. When I booked the night I made sure they knew in case I had to pay a deposit.

everyoneShouldKnow: They do not tell you the rates for valet parking. Make sure to ask ahead of time because parking is not included.
title: Don't order room service!!
comment: In two days my partner and I witnessed three unappetizing meals. Every meal I ordered was incorrectly made. The "fresh mozzarella" was nothing more than processed cheese and the pizza was not thoroughly cooked. The hotels menu did not match what the service staff was entering in their system. I ordered the Italian sausage, penne pasta, sun dried tomatoes, and sauteed spinach. Room service brought me penne pasta with marinara sauce. For breakfast my over hard eggs were undercooked and instead of herb roasted potatoes I received fruit on a stick. I pointed the mistake out to room service. They stated the system automatically assumes you would like fruit are you sure you want the potatoes? Completely unsatisfactory stay. I will never book a room at this hotel again. When checking out I stated the above issues to customer service and all they could say was sorry to hear that.

everyoneShouldKnow: Front desk, restaurant, house cleaning and gym staff are on the excellence rung.
title: Waitress Dawn
comment: We arrived for breakfast and the room was packed. As we were a party of two Dawn found us seating in another room and quickly brought coffee and water. Two unexpected guests joined us and we needed a bigger table. Dawn found a table had it cleared, moved our orders while taking care of the two late arrivals and got us settled in the meantime. If there had been one Dawn on the Italian ship nobody would have been lost or hurt. It was a spectacular display of just getting it done. We would have all applauded but the distraction might have upset her focus. She was a model for understanding the situation, the clients and who really need what and when.

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff and pool area is GREAT!
title: Very pleased
comment: After reading some of the reviews I was hesitant to stay but since most of the reviews I read were from last year when the construction was going on, I decided to stay. I am so glad I did. The staff was very friendly and helpful- some of the best staff I've seen in a hotel- and I've stay in quite a few. The rooms were clean and fresh for an old and remolded hotel. It was close to everything-so I loved the location. All in All it was a wonderful stay. Will do again !

everyoneShouldKnow: Staff needs more training at the desk.
title: Staff needs more training
comment: The staff took forever to check me in. I am platinum so all my info is already in the system. They forgot to give me access to the club level so I had to wait another 20 minutes for them to fix my access to the club level

everyoneShouldKnow: Great hotel at a great location!
title: Ideal hotel
comment: I would stay again at this hotel. Very modern and roomy. Great beds. Lots of electrical plugs and very well lit rooms.

everyoneShouldKnow: They have a wonderful staff who are really on the ball. There is also a train that starts coming by early in the morning. We did not eat once at the hotel as their prices are quite high......for example $4.50 for a cup of coffee and $8.50 for a bowl of oatmeal. There were many reasonably priced restaurants close by so eating at the hotel was not an option. I know that prices in hotel restaurants are usually high but I found the prices here really steep. If they want me to eat here make it hard for me to resist by offering affordable pricing. Whenever I came down in the glass elevator I never saw more than half a dozen people in the restaurant.......that should tell management something.
title: TIME TO CLEAN UP YOUR ACT
comment: The room I got had dirty carpets and stained chairs at the table. The table and counter were sticky.....we ended up cleaning them and the bathtub looked so dirty that we had housekeeping come and clean up again. The tub still looked dingy and unappealing. The mattress was extremely soft and in general the rooms need a facelift. The hotel itself looks quite nice and the pool area is not bad at all.

everyoneShouldKnow: The facility is tired, but the commitment of the staff makes this a recommended hotel
title: Service makes the difference
comment: The front desk staff works really hard to make sure that people feel welcomed and well served. The lobby is nice and there is a very convenient free shuttle service to LAX.

everyoneShouldKnow: Good value !
title: Beyond my expectations
comment: Staff was friendly and professional, facilities were very nice and clean,morning breakfast buffet excellent! I loved the smoked salmon and the selection of fresh fuit. Dinner menu was also very good. The location is centric but secluded, and the heated pool is a definite plus ! All around a good value for your money.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great place for a winter get away.
title: Exceeded our expectations
comment: This is was our second time at the Belvoir Portsmouth and it did not disappoint. The staff is attentive and helpful. The location is central to downtown so you can walk everywhere. The Club Level is well worth the upgrade.

everyoneShouldKnow: Friendly staff really makes you feel comfortable and at home.
title: Historic Gunter Belvoir meets all needs
comment: The Hotel staff was wonderful. Cheerful greetings and smiles made my family feel welcomed. We had some special requests and the staff accommodated every one. Rooms were spacious and enjoyed the history associated with this historic building/hotel. Great location--walking distance to all riverwalk attractions.

everyoneShouldKnow: Servicable, but don't park here.
title: Just not what I'd expect
comment: Aside from a great bar staff, I was dissapointed that I received no upgrade on a very slow Friday night and paid $26 for parking. The hallways smelled like old shoes but the rooms were spacious and the area is nice.

everyoneShouldKnow: terrible cancellation policy
title: terrible cancellation policy
comment: Had to cancel a room wless than 24 hours because of an emergency. still charging for one night. Other hotel chains do not have this policy.

everyoneShouldKnow: Not up to Belvoir Standards
title: Several Stays with problems
comment: I have not written before but reading these reviews I thought it was time. Have stayed there several times for procedures @ UofM Hospital. Only stay there again because of location and familiarity. Have had issues with heating/cooling, have had to change rooms, plumbing issues... This hotel is just not up to Belvoir standards. Parking lot is dingy and hard to navigate. Don't like wife down there while I am recovering! Please upgrade this now! I have never received points for inconvenience and no one seems to do anything about BPG membership.

everyoneShouldKnow: Peaceful oasis 5 minutes from Disneyland accessible by frequently run hotel shuttles
title: A Great Disneyland Stay
comment: My husband and I stay at this hotel often and cannot say enough about the attentive staff in all areas from the front desk to the shuttle drivers. They are warm, friendly and very willing to help in any way. The rooms are clean, roomy and the bedding is heavenly. It's a great location, a 5 minute shuttle ride to Disneyland and convenient to come back on the frequently run shuttles to take a dip in the pool or a nap when it gets hot and crowded at the Park.

everyoneShouldKnow: rooms were very clean and staff is exceedingly nice. VG platinum amenities and recognition.
title: customer service
comment: SOmetimes when you stay at a Grandbourne property, Platinum status is not recognized properly. this hotel definitely recognized platinum status and made everyone in my party feel very special.

everyoneShouldKnow: Poor sanitation
title: Room not clean
comment: We were very dissatisfied with the cleaning of our room. Bathroom floors never washed- rug in room never vacuumed. Some days we had a bath rug in front of the sink, other days none. Bugs in the room. They got into my medicine pill case and were crawling over my medicine. I had to discard a week of medicine.

everyoneShouldKnow: There is a ferry right at the hotel to take you to Manhattan and runs pretty regularly to avoid traffic and delays.
title: Hospitality Exemplified
comment: Having come up from Virginia last minute for a funeral we didn't expect more than a typical hotel stay. The check in had wrong information for us but the night manager took care of us and put us in a suite to make up for it. Besides a very comfortable room to stretch out in we were treated like family by the staff who went out of their way to make us feel welcome. The atmosphere was genuine from the entire hotel and the restaurant.

everyoneShouldKnow: Marginal at best.
title: Repairs needed!!!
comment: While the room was clean and comfortable, there were many items that needed attention. First and foremost was the security latch on the door, which was hanging by a single screw and completely non-functional. The lamp fixture by one bed was so loose that if you tried to turn on the light, the whole fixture rotated to be upside down. The other fixture was loose as well and could only be used with caution. The makeup mirror was about to fall off the wall. Cable reception was shaky. Also, there are NO nice restaurants within walking distance and NO shopping or other attractions besides the art museum within walking distance.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location!
title: Good location
comment: I would only stay at this hotel again because of its convenient location adjacent to the French Quarter and access to the trolly. I was underwhelmed by the hotel in general. I booked a king room, but none were available when I arrived--only double rooms were available. My husband and I alternated between sleeping in separate beds like Lucy and Ricky, and squeezing together in a double bed. Then, there was the fire alarm that startled us out of bed at dawn one morning. Bathroom had mildew.

title: Great Business Hotel
comment: This Belvoir was great... The hotel was in good shape, the staff were professional and helpful and they recognize BPG elite travelers very well. I'll stay here again next time I'm in Boston.

everyoneShouldKnow: Stay for the convenience for the airport. I wouldn't select for a "stay" in the city.
title: Big hotel, convenient for airport
comment: My expectations were not too high. I selected this hotel because it was convenient to the airport. I had stayed at this hotel many years ago for a large conference.

everyoneShouldKnow: The hotel has the potential to be a 5 star hotel but at this time is only a 3 star
title: Hotel location is very good
comment: This hotel needs a lot to work to get it up to Sheridan standards. As it is right now it is not a good value for the price. I believe the staff need more training and the rooms need updating. The furniture was terrable and the rugs where stained, very unacceptable for the price you pay. Work seem to be going on after hours on the next floor down and jackhammering could be heard after 6 PM. This is totaly unacceptable. As you can see by the other reviews this is not what we expect from BPG.

everyoneShouldKnow: The hotel is split between two towers, with most facilities concentrated around the Marina Tower.
title: Very Pleasant Stay
comment: The Belvoir is a very large hotel with over 1000 rooms, but you wouldn't know it because it's divided between two towers and the property is quite extensive. I stayed in the Marina tower and was attending a large conference.

everyoneShouldKnow: everyone should know Donna (a.m.) & Lucy (p.m.) club floor clubroom welcome staff ladies. This is a good place to stay.....
title: examples
comment: Confirmed EARLY check in did not happen, upon reading reviews this is a frequent problem, however, staff did what they could. They did upgrade from club floor (still retained privileges) to top floor overlooking water garden. I recommend room 1224 quiet & good view. Very clean room. Cleaning crew helpful. Ordered 11:30 p.m. room service - great service friendly service by young lady... Luggage staff very helpful.

everyoneShouldKnow: Excellent attentive staff and first rate food service crew.
title: Friendly Staff
comment: I have stayed at this property several times and it is great to be recognized and welcomed back by the attentive Front Desk staff.

title: Disappointed
comment: I visited this hotel on a business trip. I was expecting more from a Belvoir. The hotel was clean and everyone was friendly however little things were disappointing. First, this hotel needs to invest in fabric softener! Towels were hard. Second, I ordered room service and was told it would be 30 minutes. Two hours later it had not arrived so I went to bed. A huge disappointment is no free wi-fi in the rooms. Its available only in the lobby. A huge inconvenience for business travelers! Granted you could pay for it but I could go to a cheaper hotel and get it for free! The airport shuttles were convenient and helpful!

everyoneShouldKnow: Lots of history
title: Another great visit
comment: Always enjoy staying at this hotel when my business takes me to Chattanooga. Great hotel with a lot of history. Comfortable room and good workout facilities.

everyoneShouldKnow: Very comfortable and laid back. Perfect Key West Vibe.
title: Wonderful Stay
comment: Being in Key West, we didn't really stay much at the hotel, however, when we were there, the room was great. The showers were clean, bed was incredibly comfortable, the hotel itself was very Key West. The colors, the vibe were incredibly relaxing. Its away from the hustle and bustle of Duval Street, this place is definetly a place I'll be returning to. Staff was friendly, concierge was great in helping us plan our weekend. They offer shuttle service to the downtown area or to rent scooters, and taxis are literally a minute away ready to go. Overall it was great. I really enjoyed this hotel.

everyoneShouldKnow: Beautiful updated hotel!
title: Worth the wait!!
comment: We stay at this hotel at least six times a year! We did not run into any of the noise issues associated with the renovation. The staff was very helpful, and even remembered us! The renovation is beautiful, and was definitely worth the wait! Any issues with the construction going on was so minor I don't even think it could be called an inconvenience. The pool area and fire pit is amazing. My kids loved it! I am very pleased that the rooms now have a mini fridge. That is a huge bonus for my family. We have a trip planned later this month, and another one the following month. Looking forward to it!

everyoneShouldKnow: Convenient to lots of things downtown
title: Very Pleasant Experience
comment: Let me say that I am a recent BPG gold attainee, and this was my first experience as a gold member at a larger Belvoir. The Four Points I stay at on a regular basis really doesn't have much in the way of upgrades, so it was quite fun to be recognized.

everyoneShouldKnow: No enclosed hotel to garrage access so winter time is very inconvenient.
title: Stays and Parking
comment: I am platinum member but was not given an upgrade. I am very pleases with other Belvoir Hotels particularly the Florida area were they always give me suite on check in.

everyoneShouldKnow: Fairly near good food, Trader Joe's and Costco.
title: Once a year stay
comment: We have stayed here for 9 or 10 days every February for the last 4 years during the Gem and Mineral Show. We are usually automatically upgraded to a small suite (Gold level), but this time I reserved (with points) a larger suite that included the Club Lounge. Pleasantly surprised to be upgraded to the Presidential Suite! Full fridge and large rooms and a large dining table and chairs. Wonderful for our longer stay with the ability to spread things out for record keeping. Enjoyed the Club Lounge with the usual pleasant, friendly staff. The management seems to take seriously all the reviews I've read elsewhere when criticisms are made and actively seek to remedy them. We'll return next year!

everyoneShouldKnow: its an older airport hotel with renovations and a club lounge
title: older Belvoir with renovations
comment: It is right in the middle of the airport and you could walk to the terminal. They have a free shuttle anyway. It's very close to several car rental facilities and they give you ear plugs in case the planes get too loud taking off from the runway (which you can see out your window). The food is great and the continental breakfast has everything from fresh fruit to delicious scrambled eggs.

everyoneShouldKnow: Uncomfortable beds
title: Mediorce Belvoir
comment: As far as Belvoir standards are concerned, this is a mediorce hotel at best. I was surprised at how uncomfortable the bed was. The furnishings were outdated; however they had updated the televisions with large flat panels. The restaurant for dinner was adequate, but the breakfast buffet was pretty good. Staff was helpful.

everyoneShouldKnow: A little tricky to find in the dark.
title: Pleasant Surprise
comment: Set in a location near the airport and town yet away from the noise and traffic, this hotel boasts lovely views from all the rooms of the harbor and/or marina. Each room has a small lanai deck making it possible to access the sweet fresh air of the coast and take in a little sun.

everyoneShouldKnow: Fabulous front desk staff and free airport shuttle
title: Great airport hotel with fabulous front desk staff
comment: My family and and I stayed at this property for a brief visit while in transit through the Atlanta airport. I am a very frequent Grandbourne guest, and this time I was traveling with my family. The front desk staff provided a larger room, and maid services brought up a roll away and extra blankets very quickly. The staff could not have been more helpful. The room was very clean and comfortable. We had tired kids, and everyone was very happy and got some rest. We were particularly pleased with Calleen assistance and help (front desk night supervisor I think).

everyoneShouldKnow: Great staff!
title: Consistant Quality
comment: I have stayed at this facility 6 times and the consistant quality and dedication by the staff is superb. On each stay I have been treated as a family member. The rooms are always clean and are a good value.

everyoneShouldKnow: if they are full, don't expect them to go out of their way to accommodate your needs.
title: Recently disappointed
comment: I have stayed at this hotel several times and until my recent experience was always satisfied. I am a BPG Platinum member. On my most recent trip I had the occasion to extend my business trip after my reservation was originally made. My travel agent called the hotel and made the request to extend. She was informed that the hotel was full but due to my status they would find a way to fit me in. When I checked in, my reservation had not been extended. Furthermore when I told the person checking me in this story, she informed me that I would need to call the BPG desk to be accommodated. When I had my travel agent do that, she was informed that the only way they could get me in was if I paid an extremely ridiculous rate of over $500 for the extra night. And this after we were originally told by the hotel that they would extend my reservation with no crazy rate. Hardly the service that you would expect for a platinum member, or any customer.

everyoneShouldKnow: Ok for a nights stay but nothing to write home about
title: Birthday
comment: The overall hotel was ok but there was a few areas that needs improvement. The front desk did not show me on the club level which I booked on line. The wireless internet was really slow on the 7th floor. When I turned the jacuzzi would not get hot at all. The indoor pool was to be heated and it was not. The walls in the room seem like it had been painted to cover something up. The good parts about the stay was the parking was free, the breakfast in the dining room was good. The staff was nice and helpful other than getting me to the club level. I think it was over priced for what was offered.

everyoneShouldKnow: It's e-mail address.
title: Electronic Communications
comment: Why don't you publish your e-mail address? You have encouraged me to accept my invoice by e-mail, yet as it contains a mistake, I want to get it corrected. replying to the site that sent the invoice e-mail to me gets bounced, and there is no e-mail address on any of your electronic literature. So, other than sending you a fax or calling you, which is to be avoided due to the cost, how else other than by complaining through this review can I get in touch and resolve my problem?

everyoneShouldKnow: Beautiful views. Great front desk.
title: Renovation is causing some problems
comment: We are sympathetic to the disruption caused by the major renovation going on. This is a lovely hotel with an incredibly good front desk. The jackhammer noise was unpleasant but understandable and we tolerated it with a smile. Our light dinner at the bar was quite good. What was most surprising to us was the very, very poor breakfast we were served at a premier property like the Belvoir Oceanfront. Pancakes dry and edges curled up. Otmeal dry and crusted on top. Smoothie done with little fruit and crushed ice. Croissant made from bread dough--nothing delicate about it. Generally AWFUL! And a staff that cared only minimally. Just not even close to Belvoir standards.

everyoneShouldKnow: Although it is beautiful, its lobby design allows noise to travel up through the floors of the hotel.
title: Valentine's Day 2012
comment: My husband & I were looking for a quick getaway for Valentine's Day... The staff were wonderful: friendly, helpful, and polite. The hotel beautiful. The room nice, clean, and roomy. The bed comfy, the bathroom clean. The Waterside Restaurant was pleasant and the food was good and plentiful. Unfortunately, we wouldn't stay here again. The way the hotel is designed, with the lobby open right up through all the floors making for a very noisy hotel. Lobby noises traveled up to the 7th floor where we staying. If the heater was not running, we heard everything. And not to mention, the inconsiderate guests (not the hotel's fault) next to us - and the very thin walls. We heard them very clearly directly their "dates" to the hotel and later joining them. We called the front desk, but we would have to move.. and we were tired so we just turned the heater on... just a poorly designed hotel, but a beautiful one. If you do stay here, take a portable sound machine to drown out the noises. Now, I have to deal with fixing my hotel bill.. the dinner was supposed to be included in the Valentine's Day package and it was charged to my credit card instead...

everyoneShouldKnow: Good location, but not worth the money.
title: Terrible
comment: We had approximately 400 employees in the hotel for a kickoff meeting. The staff was nice. They are upgrading the elevators to a new system I have never seen before and seems very cutting edge. However, my room was nowhere near the elevator shaft, room 3123, and I could hear the elevators constantly. In room menu was very limited and more expensive than I usually see, but the food was good. I would have gone out for food, but needed to work. The carpet in the hallway on my floor was worn through and bunching up- possible trip hazard. We had a 6 hour meeting in a room that apparently backed up to a main street and we could hear cars and trucks throughout the presentations. The biggest issue was that after the first night, my phone in my room did not work and therefore my internet connection would not work. I called and an engineer came to check on it, but all he did was plug/unplug the phones which I had already done. He said someone else would have to repair it the next day so I told him I would be out of the room by 8:30 AM. No one ever came to repair the phones so for a little over 2 days I did not have phone or internet in the room and I had to work from the lobby- others in my group also had phone problems from their rooms. I would not recommend the hotel and unfortunately we have a large customer meeting in the same hotel in June.

title: Hotel noise
comment: Overall it was good experience because I had a sound machine. I found that the walls are extremely thin because I could hear clearly the conversations, alarm clocks, etc... from the rooms next door. I was surprised to hear the alarm clock go off next door at 5:30am one morning and it sounded like it was in my room. Then another night there was a couple of gentlemen next door that really liked to talk and it also sounded like they were in my room. Then I could hear the elevators going up and down all night long. I am thankful that I had a sound machine on my phone that I could turn on to drown out the noise. Needless to say I didn't have restful nights while I stayed. Everything else was really nice.

everyoneShouldKnow: Stay away from this hotel!
title: Don't stay in this hotel
comment: I'm an BPG Platinum Member. The hotel is dated, the staff don't really care about your needs, they are supposed to have "updated" beds however the one in my bedroom has seen better days, it was probably the worse bed I've ever slept on and I came back home feeling every spring on my back!.

everyoneShouldKnow: Clean, safe,
title: Average, needs a little TLC
comment: I stay here often. Things are looking a little brighter then last year but still need a bump up. I stayed in a 2 floor suite, room 112. Overlooks the pool but basically only used the upstairs bedroom. Room was clean but needs to be updated and painted. Paint peeling and falling from the ceiling, the light in the bathroom is loose on the wall, and Hot water was warm at best in the morning.

everyoneShouldKnow: Needs updating and replacement of carpeting.
title: The hotel needs to be updated
comment: This hotel was a big disappointment. The carpet was filthy with stains all over room. When walking with my white socks they turned black after 2-3 steps. The hotel did clean the carpet but this made no difference.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great Location
title: Excellent location
comment: My husband and I really enjoyed the hotel, the morning pastries, and the location. Anything you needed was in walking distance. Our hotel was a few steps from the beach and viewable from our room.

everyoneShouldKnow: Excellent Location
title: Excellent Choice, Minutes from LAX
comment: I have stayed at the Belvoir LAX more than 20 times over the past few years, love this hotel for its location.

title: Dawn
comment: A very pleasent and enjoyable breakfast every morning with Dawn starts the day off perfect!

title: Just Medium
comment: Overall, a pleasant stay. I highly recommend using valet parking - the walk from the parking garage is nightmarish! The staff was great and very helpful with directions. The rooms are "okay" - just not what I normally see for the price.

everyoneShouldKnow: Rooms are good and its fine for a business trip.
title: A few days in February
comment: I have stayed at this hotel a few times and it is a good hotel to stay at when having to quickly go to and from DCA. There was a problem picking us up at the airport, rather than come right away, we had to wait 50 minutes until it coincided with the 3:00 pm airport drop off, because the driver did not want to make two trips. Someone over there finally put there foot down and sent the driver. After that snafu, our stay was delightful. Yes the hotel is a little older, but the people make up for it.

everyoneShouldKnow: The Lounge is very special.
title: The Lounge is very nice
comment: The Lounge was very quiet during the day and allowed me to work in a very nice environment. This is a very different and positive experience compared to lounge offerings of other hotel brands.

everyoneShouldKnow: This hotel is expensive and fails to provide necessities. Ammenities not available as advertised and pricey.
title: terrible hotel
comment: This Belvoir is managed poorly. The management is very rude and the quality of the ammenities are not accpetalbe. The spa has been closed for months. The whirlpool broken for months. The complete experience is "take your chances"

everyoneShouldKnow: It's Cheap! and it's dirty.
title: What a Disappointment!
comment: After checking in, which was very pleasant, we encountered one disappointment after the other. The Shower was broken (Not allowing you to cut off bath water all the way, resulting in half the pressure not being available), the fixtures were old and rusted. plastic cups in the room! really? Plastic cups in a Belvoir? Ceiling in bathroom peeling, hole in bathroom ceiling. Outlets that were damaged in the room. and, perhaps the largest disappointment of all, a bottled water with a big sign asking ... "Are you thirsty"? and an area so small you needed magnifying glass to see it, that said $3.00!! How embarrassing!

everyoneShouldKnow: JR's is Great food and staff!
title: So much potential
comment: This hotel has great staff and we LOVE the restaurant staff (and food) at JR's in particular. the club level floor is beautifully redone for the lounge but the rooms are still disappointing. rooms and bathrooms are outdated and the A/C and Heating system are really noisy. We stay here because we love our Grandbourne points but we are contemplating a change for the next visit unless the rooms get a makeover soon

everyoneShouldKnow: On site self parking for $10 per night
title: Best property in Stamford
comment: Clean and spacious rooms. great location. recently renovated property. Great recognition as an BPG Platinum member. I have stayed here several times and have always been upgraded to a suite.

everyoneShouldKnow: Perfect location for Disney adventures
title: A great night!
comment: I had a 1 night stay in Orlando and decided to give the Dolphin a shot as I had stayed at most of the other Grandbourne properties around. I could not have been happier with my stay. As a Platinum I was upgraded to the Grand Suite and it was delightful. The view was good. They only disappointment is that the gym is a good distance from all rooms. As a Platinum the resort fee was also waived which was a great touch. Rooms could use a little upgrading but you are right on the resort so what more could you ask for.

title: This hotel offers great service!
comment: Sandee did an outstanding job! Superb Service! U.S. Army thanks you!

everyoneShouldKnow: Great service for a large hotel
title: Great service especially for large hotel
comment: Let. Me start at the end of my stay. I departed at 445 am in the morning to find a front desk armed with four agents ready to check out customers. Since my plane left at 7 am, I got up so early. This hotel knows guests are in a rush to catch early planes and they are fully prepared for business travelers.

everyoneShouldKnow: Pool complex is nice.
title: Step it up
comment: Let's see, more than $7.00 for two 12 oz. cups of coffee in the 24 hour cafe. Coffee was cheaper in Epcot than it was in the hotel. I don't care what brand it is, $3.50 a cup is stupid. I felt ripped off.

everyoneShouldKnow: 24 hour shuttle to the airport - runs every 20 minutes
title: NIce property by airport
comment: This is a nice smoke-free hotel close to the Atlanta Hartsfield airport. Friendly staff, good food.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location, awesome staff
title: Best in Westshore!
comment: Been to this property twice, and have been impressed with the way I am treated everytime.

everyoneShouldKnow: One of the few FLL hotels  on the beach!
title: A hidden gem in Fort Lauderdale
comment: I regularly travel to FLL for a week at a time and the Belvoir FLL is one of my favorite hotels of the entire BPG chain.

everyoneShouldKnow: It is the ONLY hotel ON CAMPUS at Syracuse university.
title: room was disappointing
comment: The bed was lumpy, the sheets were starched so much, it was like sleeping in tinfoil. the sheets were loud and uncomfortable. The TV didn't work. the Free coffee downstairs in the lobby was no longer free, in fact it was more expensive than outside the hotel. The elevator was being upgraded on the single busiest day of the year (the hotel was sold out months in advance). They knew this, yet still had the elevator floor being replaced (new tile. really? this day?). the hotel bar has been renovated to look like a "lounge". This is a hotel ON CAMPUS, yet the previous bar decorations of the campus was removed and a lounge look as installed. It smells of corporate decision. 90% of the visitors are Syracuse University (SU) alumni or game visitors- why would they abandon the SU look? lastly, when I was checking out, I was asked how my visit was, I offered up the above complaints.... to no reaction. All that tells me is that she really didn't want to hear my complaint, wasn't interested in my feelings and had no control of any situation to correct. I come to this hotel once a year, every year for the last 6 years. I am an BPG member. very disappointed. we shall see how this review is responded to.

everyoneShouldKnow: No Belvoir Club Lounge
title: Not a property for a business trip
comment: It's not a Belvoir hotel for a business trip. No Belvoir Club lounge. No breakfast for Platinum members in lieu of the typical Club one (not even continental) No easily accessible additional electrical outlets at the night stand or desk. Not offered the "standard suite" Platinum upgrade. They did have several but I had to ask.

everyoneShouldKnow: Friendly staff
title: Some minor issues, but overall good
comment: The location is excellent. The staff is very professional and friendly. They went above and beyond. The room had a few minor issues: stain in the shower, black-out curtains weren't hung properly so there was sunlight coming in. There was no refrigerator. And only the network stations were available in HD. All other stations were standard def which wasn't very good. All in all, I would recommend staying here.

everyoneShouldKnow: It is a great place to stay to have fun in New Orleans.
title: Professional staff and great location
comment: I have stayed at this hotel on several occasions and am never disappointed. The staff is very helpful and personable and the rooms are clean and comfortable. There is a new elevator system and though the hotel was full we never had long to wait for elevators. I can't wait for my next trip to NOLA.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great property on San Diego bay and even though it's close to the airport you rarely hear any noise.
title: Always a favorite
comment: I have stayed at this property many times. It is always one of my first choices when booking a stay in San Diego. The staff is always very attentive and courteous and I almost always receive upgrades with incredible views. The location is very convenient to many San Diego attractions if staying for business or pleasure. Although the hotel is located close to the airport, you don't hear hardly any airport noise. Especially at night and in the morning when it would be expected. Pool has movie nights which is a great plus and the Grandbourne lounge is on the top floor with great views of the water.

everyoneShouldKnow: Good for business in RTP.
title: Solid business travelers hotel
comment: This Belvoir is good choice for doing business in the RTP area of Raleigh, NC. The hotel's common areas are updated and offers dining, full bar, coffee shop and gift shop - everything you need. Healthclub next door is well equipped.

everyoneShouldKnow: Stay away!
title: Don't stay here!
comment: The pool was closed all 5 days of stay and we were not given another place to go. We were told the day before so there was no time to book somewhere else. Men working outside windows all day.

everyoneShouldKnow: It's a perfect location to downtown DC, tourist memorials and a shopping mall.
title: Must have been an "off" day!
comment: I've stayed at this hotel many many times and have, for the most part, been very pleased. However, my February 10th stay was below standards. I checked in between 5 and 6:00. When given my room # I asked was it on a club floor? (I'm a gold BPG member). I was told no, they had a large check-out earlier and the rooms weren't cleaned. I should have been offered parking, but was not. When I got to my room, the view was nice however, my room did not look thoroughly cleaned. There was trash in my waste basket, only ONE hand towel and the overall smell of the room was not fresh!

everyoneShouldKnow: Great Staff
title: Beyond our expectations
comment: A romantic getaway was helped tremendously by this hotel. Great staff, fantastic room and they were able to accomadate each request we made without any problem. We will be back!

everyoneShouldKnow: Very nice and clean. Staff was helpful
title: Nice hotel
comment: Overall it was a great experience. The only complain that I have was the breakfast. Three of us did the Buffet and I did the regular order and in all case the food was lukeworm and the food was nothing to write home about. I did complain and the charges (very expensive) were removed. Also you need to check your charge when you order drinks etc when you are at the pool. In my case additional items were added which we did not order. Also know that they automatically include tips in the check (at the pool area at least), which was not communicated when my wife added the additional tip ( I guess the bar tender was very happy.

everyoneShouldKnow: The beds rock
title: Spiders in my room
comment: I attend an annual conference each a year. Last year my nice quite stay, that I look forward to, was ruined by dogs barking, people smoking, and partying in the halls. This year my room on the 4th floor was quiet, room service was good. Internet worked very poorly the first night and the second even with their technical support we were unable to connect. I count on internet, so this was disappointing. But to top off the stay I woke up with a spider bite on my face. Later found one on my leg. Yikes!!!

everyoneShouldKnow: If you are BPG preferred member I would check the points given in your account after your stay.
title: Needs improvement
comment: I have stayed at this hotel for the last 5 weeks because it was convenient to my client's location. I must say that every week there was something wrong. Nearly every week there was confusion surrounding the Go green make a choice where you can decline your room being serviced in order to get BPG points. I had to contact the front desk every week and it still was never fully resolved so I gave up. This week I ordered room service and it was delivered 40 minutes later then promised. The meal ended up being free but it was not very good once it arrived. I will be moving hotels very shortly and increasing my commute by 10 miles in order to try a different hotel. Wish I had better news for those reading but it's just my story. God luck!

everyoneShouldKnow: Subpar customer service
title: Did not meet expectations
comment: Not equipped to handle volume of large conferences. Inadequate valet parking, curbside wait was lengthy, check-in wait was lengthened by only 2!! staffers during extremely busy weekend. No Wireless in rooms.

everyoneShouldKnow: Guests are allowed to act like ignorant animals and make so much noise that will keep you up all night.
title: NO Sleeping at this Hotel!!
comment: My husband and I were kept awake throughout the night because of loud neighbors, who were banging on the walls and playing loud music. My husband went to the front desk to complain and couldn't find anyone. We left the next morning totally exhausted due to lack of sleep. Awful experience!

everyoneShouldKnow: Although the hotel did not meet my expectations, I was not disappointed.
title: Good hotel, but not what was expected.
comment: The reason my boyfriend and I chose the Belvoir was the "jetted tub" in the room's description. However, upon entering our room we realized there was no such thing. Had we known this, we would have booked a hotel closer to our event on the landing.

everyoneShouldKnow: parking $$$
title: Rooms need updating
comment: I upgraded to a deluxe roof for an additional $20 per night. I was not impressed with the room. The bathroom had pink tiles like many old homes have. I think the $20 up charge was sort of a sham.

everyoneShouldKnow: Fantastic hotel in a great location with excellent professional staff
title: Great Portsmouth Belvoir
comment: The Belvoir is a great hotel within walking distance of downtown. Great people, service and the room was really nice, overlooking the river.

everyoneShouldKnow: Don't expect Belvoir quality rooms and if your flight arrives late best of luck to you getting what you paid for.
title: First Night of Honeymoon ruined
comment: We had to sleep in seperate beds the first night of our honeymoon because the hotel gave our room away, even though I called twice from 2 different airports to inform them we were delayed! The gave us the only room left at midnight and it was horrible with a view of the roof. Were told we could change it for the second of only 2 nights at this location. Next morning they moved us to a room that was not much better but at least had the King bed we were still charged for both nights. Only fix the manager did was treat us to breakfast which hardly made up for cost of ruining our first night on our honeymoon.

everyoneShouldKnow: good location
title: its a good spot
comment: when i arrived the person at the check in desk seemed preoccupied and unknowledgeable. he did not acknowledge me as a BPG member. i asked if they had a suite with a pull out couch available. he did not know if any rooms have this option. after asking someone he was told that there are no rooms in the hotel that have this. i said thats ok i will just take type of room that i reserved. when i travel and i get to my room the first thing i do is go to the window to see the view. to my dismay i had a view of the roof of a lower part of the hotel. i was under the impression that as a platinum BPG member i would at least get a room with a decent view. i went to the desk and asked for a better room. they were accomodating i got a room with a nice view but the room smelled so bad from cigarette smoke that both of my children began to have an asthma fit, so i went back down to ask for a new room and was accomodated. (3rd time was the charm.) the room was clean and modern. the bathroom had a granite vanity but was small. the lobby was open and inviting. the Belvoir club is on the top floor and has a nice view. the evening food selection is poor, however the breakfast was nice. the best thing about this hotel is its location. it is situated between the outlet mall and the convention center with an indoor walkway to the convention center.

everyoneShouldKnow: Request the beach tower if you want to be on the beach. Most hotels in the area are across the street from the beach due to current building codes.
title: Directly on the beach in Ft. Lauderdale
comment: This was our first stay at the hotel since the renovations. We booked two rooms in the beach tower, which is the building that is directly on the beach. To our pleasure, the manager called me and said that he was going to upgrade us to the presidential suite and the adjoining room, which, being only a Gold member, was beyond expectations. The hotel was busy but the staff did all they could to make our stay a good one.

everyoneShouldKnow: SOOO easy to get to NYC - a respite from the hustle
title: Excellent
comment: Great staff.

everyoneShouldKnow: Friendly Staff and Clean Rooms
title: Great Hotel
comment: Easy to check-in. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Enjoyed the bar and dinner area. The room was very clean, although not brand spanking new. The bed and bathroom were very clean and comfortable. As an BPG member, we were upgraded without even asking..very nice. We will definitely stay here again. With the great rates, this hotel was an exceptional value!!

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff is great; the GM does not know his business.
title: Poor Management
comment: After spending an hour and a half on the phone with their contract computer department, they had the nerve to charge my bill for the phone call!

everyoneShouldKnow: The food at the lobby bar is the best choice at the hotel -- try the make your own salad with grilled shrimp or with cinamon rubbed beef.
title: Friendly, efficient staff make this hotel a winner!
comment: I give this hotel a top rating because of the great staff service. From the bellman to the concierge to the desk clerks, everyone greats you warmly and you can't help but feel that they truly mean it. As a frequent traveller (platinum) I have repeat visits to many hotels. This is one of the few where staff acknowledge you with a "good to see you again greeting." Also, "Miss Jackie" in the club room is a treat who greats nearly everyone with a hug and a "Hi Sweetie." It's a great way to start your day. Her colleague Ron and bartenders Alisa and Jaime are equally upbeat and professional.

everyoneShouldKnow: Only a Cat. 2 so use your points
title: If you want to use points this is the property for you
comment: Although this property is miles from the beach if you are looking to take a Florida vacation this is a great option. At only 3000-4000 points a night you can have a great week long vacation for minimal points. The pool is good and the rooms are average.

everyoneShouldKnow: nice area...close to restaurants and main streets
title: Nice and restaurants nearby
comment: Nice room, comfortable bed. But our room had no heat so they tried to fix it. (unsuccessfully) FInally at 10 pm, they moved us to a smaller room, not nearly as nice as our king room, but at least the heat worked in there. Overall we had no other problems at the hotel.

everyoneShouldKnow: Super easy access to BJCC
title: Average Room, Super Staff
comment: All the staff was super nice with the exception of our server at the sports bar/cafe. He barely said 2 words to us and didn't smile until we were leaving. We tried being extra nice/funny to him, but he was not very pleasant. All other staff, including the "hostess" at sports bar, was very sweet and helpful. The bathroom floors needed cleaning a little better. You could see urine stains on the floor and the tray on the counter that held the soaps and lotions looked like it had not been cleaned in years. The hallway to our room was really hot and there were large stains on the carpets. The bed was really comfortable. We were in town for a concert, and the accessibility to the venue was super quick and easy.

everyoneShouldKnow: Gym is great but no pool or sauna.
title: Belvoir Crystal City
comment: Stayed at this Belvoir for an entire month. Here are my observations:

everyoneShouldKnow: Catering staff is awesome!
title: Great for business, leisure, or romantic getaway
comment: BPG Meeting Planner since 2001, phenomenal property, great rooms, outstanding catering services, and the location is second to none!

everyoneShouldKnow: BPG members receive a 20 percent discount at the buffet breakfast.
title: An excellent place to stay if you are at the Hynes Conv. Ctr
comment: I am the author of the 1 star internet review. Now, having stayed here, I want to make it clear that this is truly an excellent hotel--with the exception of charging $12.95 + tax for internet access. The hotel is a class operation. Food's a little pricy, but it is downtown Boston in Feb. and not everyone wants to walk outside for a meal. The only issues that I had were with the outlets in the room. They weren't convienent for having my phone charging and my computer. A minor maint. item with the shower head not being tight to the long hose was addressed by the time I returned to the room. That plus the internet is the only reason the rating isn't excellent across the board. Don't hesitate to choose this hotel.

everyoneShouldKnow: Wonderful food!
title: Wonderful Experience
comment: I was very impressed with the hotel's staff. Everyone was very pleasant and accommodating. The manager-Peterson-went out of his way to help me get a room to attend a conference that was being held at the hotel. He offered the hotel shuttle to take me to a nearby hotel until a room was available.

everyoneShouldKnow: Perfect blend of the busy of Waikiki and beauty of Hawaii.
title: Perfect
comment: I was unsure about coming to Waikiki as I love the other islands....This Grandbourne Hotel is wonderful. From the grounds, location, sevice everything. Everything was MORE than I expected.

title: Check In/Out Slow, Wi Fi Access
comment: The check in and out process took far too long at this hotel, 30 mins and 15 mins respectively. My company has an agreement with Grandbourne properties for compliementary wi-fi access, yet here I had to pay for both lap top and smart phone. Room service and bell staff were very prompt and helpful during the stay.

everyoneShouldKnow: The pools are too cold...may be great for August, but not February!
title: POOLS TOO COLD
comment: My three boys and I came down to Chandler to see Grandma during their mid winter break from school. Grandma's pool is not heated at her house, so we decided to stay at the Wild horse for a few days to play in the pools and use the water slides. Unfortunately, the pools were too cold to play for any extended time in, and the boys spent their time running from the slides to the hot tubs.

everyoneShouldKnow: The Ferry drop of and pick-up is at the front door and runs every 15 min to New York. This trip takes 10 min.
title: Home away from Home
comment: Excellent Staff that pays attention to the details. Great Views of New York with easy access to the city by Ferry.

title: Carlos in Club room is excellent
comment: Carlos in the club room is very personable; keeps the club room well stocked and greets everyone.

everyoneShouldKnow: It is seeped in history but yet modern and convenient.
title: History combines with modern features here.
comment: The staff was very attentive and the room was large and comfortable. The bed was really soft and fluffy. The Read House is downtown and close to many activities.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great hotel staff!
title: Hotel Staff made you feel at home
comment: Our stay started with Jocelyn checking us into the hotel, she was very patient and worked with us to make sure we got the best room available. Secondly, their was a small bar in the lobby where the bartendar was very friendly and slowed the day down to a relaxing pace. Lastly, the Atrium restuatrant had a great wait staff and was very acoomodating and pleasant. Overall, it was not the hotel, but the staff that made my stay enjoyable.

everyoneShouldKnow: This place needs total renovation.
title: This hotel was not Belvoir Quality
comment: I had booked 2 nights with cash and points 2/16-2/17. We only spent 1 night.

everyoneShouldKnow: Is that you should stay here.
title: Service Plus
comment: Again I am extremely satisfied with this location. Chris is always so on top of things at check-in. Tina is one of the best Bar Tenders ever. And Kyle takes so much pride in making your stay a memorable one. Food in the restaurant is good but if you want to eat out there is a huge number of places to choose from. Great location for shopping , and entertainment. Easy access. This location has many positives but the best positive is the staff.

title: Great place
comment: Enjoyed my stay, great place to stay in Northern ATL

everyoneShouldKnow: Excellent location
title: Great location
comment: Central location,walking distance to Mich.Ave,Navy Pier. Great restaurants nearby. Convenient shuttle to Auto Show. Excellent view of river and night lights

everyoneShouldKnow: The hot tub and pool are great!
title: Weekend Visit
comment: We stayed over Austin Marathon Weekend and loved this place!

everyoneShouldKnow: Subterrain parking ramp wreaks havoc on GPS! :-)
title: My new favorite in Chicago!
comment: I have been to Chicago several times for business and pleasure and have not stayed at a hotel as lovely as the Belvoir Towers for my price range! Every person on the staff was pleasant and accomodating, the facilities were more than expected and the location was excellent! If only my GPS could understand the underground system, I would have had a PERFECT week there!

everyoneShouldKnow: A downtown hotel in the live music capitol of the world so expect some noise especially on weekends!
title: Terrific Stay
comment: Good location, clean rooms and Texas Hospitality! What more could you want? We were upgraded to a suite on the 14th floor which was great. The staff was helpful with reccomendations and fitness center met our needs and then some.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great price for a downtown property
title: Great Room
comment: Stayed last weekend and had a blast! This hotel is close to 6th street and several other sites to see in Austin. Weekends are a mix of partygoers so expect late night traffic in the halls and some noise from the music scene in downtown. A good place for couples or those wanting to have a night on the town.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location and staff to go with it!
title: Race Weekend
comment: Came in for the Austin Marathon and had a great experience. The hotel is older but offers a great fitness center/pool area and the staff make up for the aging building. It was a little noisy but thats to be expected on a weekend in Downtown Austin.

everyoneShouldKnow: It is centrally located with EVERYTHING you need close
title: My 2 month stay
comment: I ended up at this hotel for 2 months, I had an uncle who was ill, and had no other family. The staff here are wonderful! They were always willing to help, listen, give directions, look things up on the computer.. what I needed, they were there to do! This hotel is centrally located and I never had to drive too far to anything. The hospital is right next door, and taking care of my uncle was easier because finding everything wasn't a problem.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great Establishment!
title: Great Service
comment: I stayed here on Feb. 18th to 19th and I checked in and was greeted by the most friendly staff. Everyone was very helpful. The rooms were clean and the bed was the best. I would definitely stay again!

title: Great location
comment: This hotel has a great location at the beach, but too far from 'downtown' for a walk. The pools are great and also the Wreck Bar and the Mermaid Show were fun. The staff were friendly and the atmosphere of the hotel was relaxed. Only downside was the very expensive self-parking - 20$ /night i just too much!!!

title: I would not stay here again
comment: Not what I expected from a Belvoir hotel. The beds sheets had to be changed several times due to the linen not being clean. The room was smaller than expected. The toilet overflowed from the top after it was flushed. I just did not have a good experience at this hotel.

everyoneShouldKnow: The food is GREAT!
title: No Convention During Mardi Gras
comment: This hotel is nice, however they were doing some sewer cleaning by the hotel, that was a bit inconvenient and smelly.

everyoneShouldKnow: Never to come here.
title: No respect Gold Status
comment: This is the last time I will stay at this property.

everyoneShouldKnow: Does not offer free internet.
title: Great location to highway
comment: Staff was very pleasant and told us of the hotel amenities/locations. Starbucks inside the hotel is great although they're open limited hours & days.

everyoneShouldKnow: Free parking and easy access to surrounding areas.
